intro: Sebaea erecta, commonly known as the upright sebaea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. Its leaves are typically ovate with serrated edges, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Sebaea erecta is often found in coastal and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained environments.
